Instruction: In the file "AB12CD.pdf", on page 3, within the second rectangle, add a table with the following content: first row "Beam, Length, Material"; second row "B1, 5m, Steel"; third row "B2, 7m, Concrete"; set the font to "Arial" and font size to 12.
Groundtruth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "AB12CD.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 2  # Page 3 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 1  # Second rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[["Beam", "Length", "Material"], ["B1", "5m", "Steel"], ["B2", "7m", "Concrete"]],
    font="Arial",
    fontsize=12
)

# Adding the table
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data"),
    font=argument.get("font"),
    fontsize=argument.get("fontsize")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)
Response_code:

# Task 1: Add table to the second rectangle on page 3 of AB12CD.pdf
filepath = "AB12CD.pdf"

# Target position extraction
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
pagenumber = 2  # Page 3 (0-indexed)
rectangleorder = 1  # Second rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content and parameters
argument = {
    "clip": rectangle,
    "data": [["Beam", "Length", "Material"], ["B1", "5m", "Steel"], ["B2", "7m", "Concrete"]],
    "font": "Arial",
    "fontsize": 12
}

# Table adding
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument["clip"],
    data=argument["data"],
    font=argument["font"],
    fontsize=argument["fontsize"]
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

Instruction: In the file "EF34GH.pdf", on page 8, within the fourth rectangle, add a table with the following content: first row "Column, Height"; second row "C1, 3m"; third row "C2, 4.5m"; adjust the row heights to [25, 20, 20].
Groundtruth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "EF34GH.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 7  # Page 8 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 3  # Fourth rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[["Column", "Height"], ["C1", "3m"], ["C2", "4.5m"]],
    arrange=[[25, 20, 20], None]
)

# Adding the table
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data"),
    arrange=argument.get("arrange")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

import PDFbf

# Task 1: Add table to EF34GH.pdf
filepath = "EF34GH.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Target position extraction

pagenumber = 7  # Page 8 (0-indexed)
rectangleorder = 3  # Fourth rectangle (0-indexed)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content and parameters
argument = {
    "clip": rectangle,
    "data": [["Column", "Height"], ["C1", "3m"], ["C2", "4.5m"]],
    "arrange": [[25, 20, 20], None]  # Row heights specified, column widths auto
}

# Table adding
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument["clip"],
    data=argument["data"],
    arrange=argument["arrange"]
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Task 1
filepath = "IJ56KL.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page 15 (zero-indexed pagenumber=14)
pagenumber = 14
# First rectangle (zero-indexed order=0)
rectangleorder = 0
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content
data = [["Load", "Type", "Value"], ["Dead", "Uniform", "10kN/m"], ["Live", "Point", "5kN"]]

# Prepare arguments
argument = {"clip": rectangle, "data": data}

# Add table
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument["clip"], data=argument["data"])
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save updated file
updatedfilepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updatedfilepath)

Instruction: In the file "MN78OP.pdf", on page 6, within the fifth rectangle, add a table with the following content: first row "Slab, Thickness, Reinforcement"; second row "S1, 150mm, T10@200mm"; third row "S2, 200mm, T12@150mm"; specify the column widths as [60, 60, 80], set the row heights to [30, 25, 25], and use the font "Times New Roman" at size 11.
Groundtruth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "MN78OP.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 5  # Page 6 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 4  # Fifth rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[
        ["Slab", "Thickness", "Reinforcement"],
        ["S1", "150mm", "T10@200mm"],
        ["S2", "200mm", "T12@150mm"]
    ],
    arrange=[[30, 25, 25], [60, 60, 80]],
    font="Times New Roman",
    fontsize=11
)

# Adding the table
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data"),
    arrange=argument.get("arrange"),
    font=argument.get("font"),
    fontsize=argument.get("fontsize")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Task 1: Add table in fifth rectangle on page 6 of MN78OP.pdf
filepath = "MN78OP.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Target position extraction
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
pagenumber = 5  # Page 6 (0-indexed)
rectangleorder = 4  # Fifth rectangle (0-indexed)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content and styling
data = [
    ["Slab", "Thickness", "Reinforcement"],
    ["S1", "150mm", "T10@200mm"],
    ["S2", "200mm", "T12@150mm"]
]
arrange = [[30, 25, 25], [60, 60, 80]]  # [row_heights, column_widths]
font = "Times New Roman"
fontsize = 11

# Table adding
argument = {
    "clip": rectangle,
    "data": data,
    "arrange": arrange,
    "font": font,
    "fontsize": fontsize
}
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument["clip"],
    data=argument["data"],
    arrange=argument["arrange"],
    font=argument["font"],
    fontsize=argument["fontsize"]
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

Instruction: In the file "QR90ST.pdf", on page 12, within the third rectangle, add a table with the following content: first row "Foundation, Depth, Width"; second row "F1, 2m, 1.5m"; third row "F2, 2.5m, 2m"; set the column widths uniformly to 50 and use font size 10.
Groundtruth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "QR90ST.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 11  # Page 12 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 2  # Third rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[
        ["Foundation", "Depth", "Width"],
        ["F1", "2m", "1.5m"],
        ["F2", "2.5m", "2m"]
    ],
    arrange=[None, [50, 50, 50]],  # Uniform column width of 50
    fontsize=10
)

# Adding the table
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data"),
    arrange=argument.get("arrange"),
    fontsize=argument.get("fontsize")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)
Response_code:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# Task execution for inserting a table in QR90ST.pdf
filepath = "QR90ST.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Target position extraction
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
pagenumber = 11  # Page 12 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder = 2  # Third rectangle (zero-indexed)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content and formatting
data = [
    ["Foundation", "Depth", "Width"],
    ["F1", "2m", "1.5m"],
    ["F2", "2.5m", "2m"]
]
arrange = [None, [50, 50, 50]]  # Column widths uniformly set to 50
fontsize = 10

# Argument collection and table addition
argument = {
    "clip": rectangle,
    "data": data,
    "arrange": arrange,
    "fontsize": fontsize
}
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument["clip"],
    data=argument["data"],
    arrange=argument["arrange"],
    fontsize=argument["fontsize"]
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)
